meanings.definition: To make three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: She triplicated her cookie recipe to make enough for all her friends.
meanings.sent2: The number of flowers in the garden triplicated after the rain.
meanings.sent3: The magician triplicated the number of rabbits in his hat, causing a comical surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her joy triplicated when she saw her favorite band perform live.
meanings.sent5: The excitement in the room triplicated as the countdown to midnight began.

meanings.definition: To be three times as much or as many
meanings.sent1: The population of the town triplicated in just a few years.
meanings.sent2: The amount of snow on the mountain triplicated overnight.
meanings.sent3: The troublemaker's mischief triplicated when left unsupervised.
meanings.sent4: His determination triplicated as he neared the finish line.
meanings.sent5: The colors of the sunset triplicated, painting the sky in vibrant hues.

meanings.definition: To make three copies or examples of
meanings.sent1: She triplicated the important document for each team member.
meanings.sent2: The artist triplicated the sketch to compare different color schemes.
meanings.sent3: The student triplicated his notes to ensure he wouldn't lose them.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter triplicated as she shared the joke with her friends.
meanings.sent5: The echoes in the canyon triplicated, creating a mesmerizing effect.
